p:
In this study, we have addressed the above questions by testing 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV in the A129 (interferon α/β receptor-deficient) pregnancy mouse model
14, 15 . Our results show that maternal vaccination of 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV is safe for pregnant mice and fetuses. A single-dose maternal immunization fully protects dams against ZIKV infection and in utero transmission. Neutralizing antibody alone is enough for protection against in utero transmission. However, a higher neutralizing titer is required to prevent in utero transmission in pregnant mice than that required to prevent viral infection in non-pregnant mice. In addition, pregnancy weakens T cell response to 3ʹUTR-∆10-LAV immunization. Furthermore, maternal neutralizing antibodies are transferred to offspring to prevent ZIKV infection.
